s2.ptxt: Using a snap ring expander, remove the snap ring.
Using SST and a press, press out the front bearing.

Coat the input shaft cone with gear oil. Check the braking effect of the No. 2 synchronizer ring. Fit the ring to the shaft cone. Apply pressure to the ring and attempt to turn it in both directions. Check that the ring locks.

item.ptxt: If the braking effect is insufficient, apply a small amount of fine lapping compound between the No. 2 synchronizer ring and the input shaft cone. Lightly rub the No. 2 synchronizer ring and the input shaft cone together.

atten3.ptxt: Ensure the fine lapping compound is completely washed off after rubbing.

s2.ptxt: Check the braking effect of the No. 2 synchronizer ring again.
Using a feeler gauge, measure the clearance between the No. 2 synchronizer ring back and the input shaft spline end.

item.ptxt: If the clearance is not as specified, replace the No. 2 synchronizer ring and apply a small amount of fine lapping compound on the input shaft cone.

atten3.ptxt: Ensure the fine lapping compound is completely washed off after rubbing.
